description.narrative:
this project is a part of a 5-year-regional program on Social Protection for Maginalized Workers in Cambodia, Vietnam and Laos, funded by DGD (Belgian Government). Targeted indirect Beneficiaries: Informal and formal economy internal migrant workers in urban and semi-urban industrial areas. Sectors covered: Manufacturing (electronics, garments), domestic workers, street vending, waste collection. Specific issues addressed at national level: Wage. Inclusion of migrant workers (formal and informal) in Social Protection policies, better coverage of social insurance fir informal workers: ex. health care, maternity benefits. Health budget monitoring, OHS (occupational Health and safety).
Impact: Internal migrant workers and families in Vietnam have more economic resilience, are less marginal and there is increased gender equality.
The project specific objective: About 40.000 organised marginalised workers in Vietnam, in particular women, can exert their rights and increase their economic and social resilience by influencing the relevant decision makers to expand, finance and deliver social protection more effectively and equitably
Result 1: The leaders and activists of 57 grassroots groups of internal migrant workers have built awareness and knowledge on migrant workers# rights to Social Protection,demonstrate democratic and gender-sensitive leadership, and engage in advocacy to defend these rights.
result 2: The member organisations of M.net (Action Network for Migrant Workers) have increased capacity to develop credible proposals / recommendations, supported by their constituencies and allies, for policy and practice changes regarding internal migrant workers# rights to better social protection .
result 3: M.net, with its members, allies and the workers# representatives, have increased advocacy capacity to influence key external actors to take into account their policy and practice proposals/recommendations regarding Social Protection policy and implementation
result 4 (specifically on partners' organizational development): Partners have increased organisational strength in terms of capacity to liaise with others, to efficiently carry out their work and to support local groups to increase their bargaining power

participating-org.narrative: In Vietnam , Oxfam is one of the leading international, non -governmental organisation. Since 1955, Oxfam is active in Vietnam withhumanitarian interventions and started development work in the late 1980's. Today, Oxfam works in 26 provinces with people, governments and civil society to promote equality and well-being through social and economic change.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
